instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message:
I found it short on line 3.42, caused by the SMC. Replaces and the short ended, but the board doesn't turn on, I tried with another SMC, same thing.

RTC_RESET_L - 3.26V
SHP_INTRUDER_L - 1.65v
PCH_INTVRMEN - 2.5v
SHP_SRTCRST_L - 3.26V

PPBUS_G3H - 8.6
PP3V42_G3H - 3.4v
PPVRTC_G3H - 3.3V
PP5V_S5 - 5v
PP3V3_S5 - 3.3V
*PP3V3_SUS - 0
SMC_ONOFF_L - 3.37v


*SMC_ADAPTER_EN - 0
SMC_PM_G2_EN - 3.4V
PM_BATLOW_L - 3.3V
*PM_PWRBTN_L - 0.34
*PM_RSMRST_L - 0
*PLT_RESET_L - 0
*ALL_SYS_PWRGD - 0

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message:
"SHP_INTRUDER_L - 1.65v"
Do you mean PCH_INTRUDER_L?
If yes, then is low enough to block PCH starting power on sequence.

Possibly accumulated crap under PCH area.
Heat it with quality flux; no more than 180-200 degrees, for 15-20s.

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message:
Yes, PCH_INTRUDER_L! I don't know why, but the cell phone always changes that! haha

I've already tried to heat it up, it didn't work!

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message: Force the signal, using 100K resistor, instead of 1M.

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message: with 100k, I have 3v in PCH_INTRUDER_L. But only this.

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message:
It should be high, if you have stable 3V3_S5.
Check R8141.

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message:
Sorry, forgot voltages on R8141.

S5_PWRGD - 3v
PP3V42 - 3.35v

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message:
R8141 is perfect - 100k - Traces, okay.

SMC_S5_PWRGD_VIN - 3v
PP3V42 - 3.35v

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message:
Then SMC is suspect.
Did you use correct SMC, from donor board?

threads.title: 820-3437 - short SMC
threads.message: yes, i took it from an 820-3437 board!  I'll try to get another SMC!
